intro: Boscia caffra, commonly known as the sour fig or wild quince, is a small, deciduous shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Capparaceae family and is characterized by its thick, fleshy leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn red or orange when mature. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Boscia caffra is also valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional African medicine.
